recommendations: Hitch Kick is a jump in which the skater kicks the back leg forward, then lands on the front foot.. For practicing Hitch Kick as a/an amateur performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Leg swings, High knees, Basic hop for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart., Kick leading leg forward., Hop on supporting leg., Kick trailing leg forward., Land on trailing leg, leading leg in front. for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on stability, additional exercises could include Plank holds, Single-leg balance, Bosu ball balance.

Chaine Leaps is a series of jumps in which the skater alternates between the front and back legs.. For practicing Chaine Leaps as a/an intermediate performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Chaine turn combinations, Saute arabesque, Saute attitude for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Begin in B-plus position., Perform a chaine turn, swinging arms., Push off the back leg, leaping with straight legs., Land on the front leg, bending knees., Continue leaping with alternating legs. for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on stability, additional exercises could include Plank holds, Single-leg balance, Bosu ball balance.

Hitch Kick is a jump in which the skater kicks the back leg forward, then lands on the front foot.. For practicing Hitch Kick as a/an intermediate performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Leg swings with pointed toes, High knees with jump, Broad jumps for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart., Kick leading leg forward, knee straight., Hop on supporting leg, bending knee., Kick trailing leg forward, knee straight., Land on trailing leg, leading leg in front. for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on stability, additional exercises could include Plank holds, Single-leg balance, Bosu ball balance.
